Package javelin.model.state

Class BattleState

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.state.BattleState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Node, TeamContainer
    public class BattleState
extends java.lang.Object
implements Node, TeamContainer
    Javelin's implementation of Node. clone() is used for cloning the state but it does not clone the Combatant instances! You need to use {@link #clone(Combatant))} afterwards to do so.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    cloneifdifferent(Combatant, Combatant)

      • isengaged

        public boolean isengaged​(Combatant c)
        To avoid having to implement attacks-of-opporutnity gonna simply prohibit that anything that would cause an aoo is simply prohibited. since the game is more fluid with movement/turns now this shouldn't be a problem. Disengaging is simply forcing a 5-foot step to avoid aoo as per the core rules.

      • haslineofsight

        public BattleState.Vision haslineofsight​(Point me,
                                         Point target,
                                         int range,
                                         java.lang.String periodperception)
        Parameters:
        range - How many 5-feet squares ahead the active combatant can see.
        periodperception - Represents the light perception for the active combatant since some monsters may have the darkvision quality or similar. If night or evening the character will not able to see past obstacles in the map.

      • gettargets

        public java.util.List<Combatant> gettargets​(Combatant combatant)
        Returns:
        As gettargets(Combatant, List) but default to targetting only units in the opposite team.

                                            java.util.List<Combatant> team)
        Parameters:
        team - From the units in this team...
        Returns:
        all that can be seen by the given Combatant.

        public boolean isflanked​(Combatant target,
                         Combatant attacker)
        Returns:
        true if there is another Combatant in the opposite side of the target (see d20 flanking rules).

      • toString

        Overrides:

      • cloneifdifferent

        public Combatant cloneifdifferent​(Combatant c,
                                  Combatant same)
        This is necessary because sometimes you don't want to clone a unit twice (which would result in 2 different clones). For example: if you have a Caster and a Target it just could be they are both the same unit (self-targetting) and in this case you don't want to clone them twice.
        Parameters:
        c - If not equal, will clone and return this unit.
        same - If equal will return this unit.

      • clonedeeply

        public BattleState clonedeeply()
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Slow, complete cloning, used elsewwhere.
        Specified by:
        clonedeeply in interface Node
        See Also:

      • getfleeing

        public java.util.ArrayList<Combatant> getfleeing​(java.util.List<Combatant> team)
        This method returns a subset of fleeing characters. Note that blueTeam and redTeam are modified for several EndBattle purposes so it might be preferable to use Fight.originalblueteam and Fight.originalredteam instead.
        Parameters:
        team - A list containing the combatants that should not be excluded from fleeing.
        Returns:
        a new list (safe for modification) containing only the units provided.

      • getcombatant

        public static Combatant getcombatant​(Combatant c,
                                     java.util.List<Combatant> combatants)
        Utility method to find a clone in this state intance. To be used with getteam(Combatant), getallcombatants(), getcombatants(), fleeing, dead, etc.
        Returns:
        The clone of the given combatant or null.

      • getallcombatants

        public void getallcombatants()
